when_to_say: Used as a general greeting during the day.
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used when parting ways for a longer time.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう！ (sayounara, mata aimashou!) - Goodbye, see you again!

when_to_say: Express gratitude informally.
example: ありがとう、助けてくれて！ (arigatou, tasukete kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning.
example: おはよう、今日はいい天気だね。 (ohayou, kyou wa ii tenki da ne.) - Good morning, it’s nice weather today.

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai.) - Excuse me, can you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used to deny or negate something.
example: いいえ、違います。 (iie, chigaimasu.) - No, that's incorrect.

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree with something.
example: はい、大丈夫です。 (hai, daijoubu desu.) - Yes, I’m fine.

when_to_say: Used when talking about a cat.
example: 私の猫は白いです。 (watashi no neko wa shiroi desu.) - My cat is white.

when_to_say: Used when talking about a dog.
example: その犬はとても可愛いです。 (sono inu wa totemo kawaii desu.) - That dog is very cute.

when_to_say: Used to describe something blue.
example: 空が青いです。 (sora ga aoi desu.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used to describe something large in size.
example: 大きい家があります。 (ookii ie ga arimasu.) - There is a big house.

when_to_say: Used when referring to eating food.
example: 私は寿司を食べます。 (watashi wa sushi o tabemasu.) - I eat sushi.

when_to_say: Used when referring to drinking something.
example: お茶を飲みますか？ (ocha o nomimasu ka?) - Do you drink tea?

when_to_say: Used when talking about going somewhere.
example: 学校に行きます。 (gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used when talking about seeing or looking at something.
example: 映画を見ます。 (eiga o mimasu.) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when talking about listening or hearing.
example: 音楽を聞きます。 (ongaku o kikimasu.) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude formally.
example: ありがとうございました！ (arigatou gozaimashita!) - Thank you very much!

when_to_say: Used to describe something interesting or funny.
example: その本は面白いです。 (sono hon wa omoshiroi desu.) - That book is interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe something quick or early.
example: 早く起きました。 (hayaku okimashita.) - I woke up early.

when_to_say: Used to describe being occupied with tasks.
example: 今日は忙しいです。 (kyou wa isogashii desu.) - I am busy today.

when_to_say: Used to describe enjoyable activities or moments.
example: パーティーは楽しいです。 (paatii wa tanoshii desu.) - The party is fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe something recently made or introduced.
example: 新しい車を買いました。 (atarashii kuruma o kaimashita.) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used to describe something aged or outdated.
example: 古い本を読みます。 (furui hon o yomimasu.) - I read an old book.

when_to_say: Used to describe something small in size.
example: 小さい家があります。 (chiisai ie ga arimasu.) - There is a small house.

when_to_say: Used to refer to someone you are friends with.
example: 友達と遊びます。 (tomodachi to asobimasu.) - I play with my friends.

when_to_say: Used to refer to educational institutions.
example: 学校に行きます。 (gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an instructor or expert.
example: 先生に質問します。 (sensei ni shitsumon shimasu.) - I ask the teacher a question.

when_to_say: Used when talking about studying.
example: 日本語を勉強します。 (nihongo o benkyou shimasu.) - I study Japanese.

when_to_say: Used to refer to food in general.
example: 美味しい食べ物があります。 (oishii tabemono ga arimasu.) - There is delicious food.

when_to_say: Used to refer to beverages.
example: 冷たい飲み物を飲みます。 (tsumetai nomimono o nomimasu.) - I drink a cold beverage.

when_to_say: Used when talking about reading.
example: 本を読みます。 (hon o yomimasu.) - I read books.

when_to_say: Used when talking about writing.
example: 手紙を書きます。 (tegami o kakimasu.) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used when talking about running.
example: 公園で走ります。 (kouen de hashirimasu.) - I run in the park.

when_to_say: Used when talking about playing.
example: 友達と遊びます。 (tomodachi to asobimasu.) - I play with my friends.

when_to_say: Used to describe height or price.
example: その時計は高いです。 (sono tokei wa takai desu.) - That watch is expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe something inexpensive.
example: このペンは安いです。 (kono pen wa yasui desu.) - This pen is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe weather or feeling cold.
example: 今日は寒いです。 (kyou wa samui desu.) - It’s cold today.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather.
example: 夏は暑いです。 (natsu wa atsui desu.) - Summer is hot.

when_to_say: Used for fun moments.
example: 旅行は楽しいです。 (ryokou wa tanoshii desu.) - Traveling is fun.

when_to_say: Used when referring to observing or watching something.
example: 映画を見る。 (eiga o miru.) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when referring to listening or hearing something.
example: 音楽を聞く。 (ongaku o kiku.) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when referring to speaking or talking.
example: 日本語を話します。 (nihongo o hanashimasu.) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to residing in a place.
example: 東京に住んでいます。 (toukyou ni sundeimasu.) - I live in Tokyo.

when_to_say: Used when referring to purchasing something.
example: 新しい本を買います。 (atarashii hon o kaimasu.) - I buy a new book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to walking.
example: 公園を歩きます。 (kouen o arukimasu.) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used when referring to standing up.
example: 部屋で立っています。 (heya de tatteimasu.) - I am standing in the room.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sitting down.
example: 椅子に座ります。 (isu ni suwarimasu.) - I sit on the chair.

when_to_say: Used when referring to drinking.
example: お茶を飲みます。 (ocha o nomimasu.) - I drink tea.

when_to_say: Used when referring to something being slow or late.
example: バスが遅いです。 (basu ga osoi desu.) - The bus is late.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed.
example: 車は速いです。 (kuruma wa hayai desu.) - The car is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasty food or drinks.
example: このケーキは美味しいです。 (kono keeki wa oishii desu.) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe something simple or easy.
example: この問題は簡単です。 (kono mondai wa kantan desu.) - This question is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something challenging.
example: この問題は難しいです。 (kono mondai wa muzukashii desu.) - This question is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe sunny weather.
example: 今日は晴れです。 (kyou wa hare desu.) - It's sunny today.

when_to_say: Used to describe rainy weather.
example: 今日は雨が降っています。 (kyou wa ame ga futteimasu.) - It’s raining today.

when_to_say: Used to describe snowy weather.
example: 雪が降っています。 (yuki ga futteimasu.) - It’s snowing.

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude.
example: 本を貸してくれてありがとう。 (hon o kashite kurete arigatou.) - Thank you for lending me the book.
